Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Charlottebth1
Reviews.Content: This was the most disgusting experience EVER! Nonrefundable dump! When we threatened to report them to the health department there response was "it happens all the time" this basically says it all along with the cockroaches dying all over the place! Don't do it!!

Reviews.Title: “FILTHIEST PLACE I HAVE EVER STAYED”
Reviews.Author: Tree9002
Reviews.Content: Considering the stench of black mold, the cockroaches, the maintenance guy spitting in the shower head to fix it (he was very friendly though) and the lying concierge this was a completely awful experience! DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: Brandenjacob
Reviews.Content: This is was the worst Place I have ever been in! It is out-dated, dirty, and shabby! No warm blankets only 1 sheet. Called front desk was told they can't help no more blankets! I asked for another room none left so was told I could look for somewhere else to go! I had to wear flip flops In the shower because I felt grossed out a out putting my feet on the floor. This was non-refundable or I would have ran out of there! The outside had cockroaches crawling around, 7 ferrel cats and out room was located facing an alley where me were doing drugs! I could go on and on! Oh and bed bugs! Stay away go next door to Days INN

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the spin”
Reviews.Author: vegasoldtimer
Reviews.Content: Be warned: The last two people who rated this hotel as a "five-star" experience HAVE to be people affiliated with this hotel who are trying to do damage control. I have already written a review here, but feel the need to reply again because staying at this hotel was such a negative experience. Don't believe the spin that others have put on this "great" hotel for its "gem"-like qualities. These descriptions are total BS. BrasilNewJersey's description of it as "crap" is right on the mark.

Reviews.Title: “a Gem in front of the Sea”
Reviews.Author: christa c
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute after an airline debacle that left me in Miami with no hotel. I was somewhat leery of staying here due to the bad reviews, but after my previously booked hotel charged me, then refused to accommodate me, I didnâ€™t have many options for the price I was able to pay. Enough of that. The hotel was a $20 shuttle ride from MIA. The hotel is not well marked, but if you have the addressee the shuttle/taxi should not have any problem finding it. Check in time is 3:00pm and there is a locked closet available to leave your stuff if you like. Fast wifi is avaible in the lobby and some rooms. The staff is friendly and accommodating. The sea is across the street. There are several bargain restaurants and drug stores within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. Several busses pass every hour headed for South Beach and Aventura mall, both of which are a $2 ride away. As for the rooms themselves, I was impressed. For the price that I paid, I can not believe the negative reviews that people have posted regarding this gem! The room was roomy, clean, and quiet. The shower was hot, water pressure was great. The bed was to die for! The fridge was cold and quiet. The channels on the TV were slightly fuzzy and the phone appeared to be broken but I did not mention the issue to the staff because I didnâ€™t really care. I highly recommend Hawaii hotel to anyone on a budget that wants to stay in Miami beach. Iâ€™ve lived in 6 countries, traveled in 13, and have 7 years of experience in the travel industry.

Reviews.Title: “Crap.”
Reviews.Author: BrasilNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We've always been advocates of small Hotels and B&Bs, but this place just confirms you get what you pay for. First - the front desk agent was the most impolite person we've ever met. Somehow checking you in at 2:30pm is supposed to be a huge favor to you. There were others waiting since 9am. They insist on charging you an extra fee for "using the safe" even if you don't want to use the safe. They refuse to accept credit card for the fee. When we tried to refuse, they told us we can leave or pay the "early check in fee" of like $30. what?! They are highly unprofessional. Don't expect anything other than a room. Don't expect anything from the free breakfast - your choice of bagels, Fruit Loops, or raisin bran.

Reviews.Title: “A well-worn hotel with small rooms”
Reviews.Author: PETERPAN1999USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small building owned by the same people at the Ocean Surf Resort next door. It's right next to an abandoned, boarded up building, so it looks pretty dingy. It has no lobby or reception. You have to be buzzed in or out by a camera linked to the Ocean Surf hotel. There is no elevator. You have to drag your luggage up the stairs. The room is small and grimy. I did not feel relaxed and comfortable in the room. A free Continental breakfast is included, which you have to walk to the Ocean Surf hotel, another small dingy hotel next door to have it. Both places are dingy and busy with young foreign visitors sitting in the lobby and out on the front porch, that they feel more like cheap hostel. Then there are a number or unkempt, homeless people who hang out at all hours day and night on the sidewalks, who would approach visitors to sell drugs. For a few more dollars a day, it feel much better and safer to go next door and stay at the Days in North Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: melissa k
Reviews.Content: The prices are low for a reason. Overall it was fine. Be sure to lock your valuables in the safe.

Reviews.Title: “a beautiful beach without tall buildings and uncrowded, allow you to enjoy the sea, the breeze and the sun”
Reviews.Author: majorro
Reviews.Content: I am very surprised reading some opinions about this hotel. It seems like if we went to another place. I think that many people doesnÂ´t want to pay a lot for a hotel night and then they want a five star service. We went to Hawaii hotel for two nights when we were travelling to Orlando. Although we had read some different opinions, good and bad reviews, we went there because of its good location. Is located in a quiet street in Miami, where you can park your car with a ticket provided from the hotel. Just cross the street and a beautiful beach without tall buildings and uncrowded, allow you to enjoy the sea, the breeze and the sun. We arrived so early and we could not be able to check inn yet, but the person that was there gave us cordially all the attention we needed to understand a map to go shopping. When we arrived we stayed at a little but clean room in the building that is right next door. The air conditioning was working, but wasnÂ´t too cool. At the next day in the morning we did our request and they gave us another, a little bigger and nice room, clean with everything you need to stay comfortably. The hotel serve a breakfast, coffee/tea, milk, cereal, bread, butter, jam and cheese, and others. For us this was enought to go to the beach, considering the price we paid for our stay there. The breakfast was served in a sunny and quiet terrace where people were reading or in internet, because you have wifi there, even though al the reception of the next building where we stayed. The breakfast was served in a sunny and quiet terrace where people was reading or in internet, because you have wifi there, like at the reception of the next building where we stayed. Maybe some pictures we took are a better way to see where you will stay if you go there. If you want something better in Miami you have to pay much more!

Reviews.Title: “DO YOURSELF A FAVOR! DO NOT BOTHER!”
Reviews.Author: Aquarossen
Reviews.Content: We traveled North ,Central, and South America! This was the worst experience,yet! The manager and the staff do not even have basic skills to communicate a problem. The low level is beyond explanation. For the price you pay ,anything is TOO MUCH ! We have read all the feedback from other guests ,but.... did not take into consideration the negative! Now we regret it ! We understand you get what you paid for but in this case we got nothing... On the end, we moved to Days inn next door, paid $10.00 more and got it all. Service, internet (fast) clean rooms, microwave, bath tub, towels, the works! So.. it is up to you!

Reviews.Title: “You're crazy if you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: vegasoldtimer
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review on Tripadvisor but felt compelled to do so to warn people not to stay at this place. I wish I'd read the reviews here before I booked my trip. The hotel was disgusting and filthy. For starters, check-in took forever even though we were the only people there because the hotel clerk was incompetent and kept answering phone calls and made us wait while he answered about five different calls. (This was at midnight after a long day of traveling.) The room was dirty with stains on the walls and ceilings and it smelled. There was no blanket on the bed (as another reviewer stated). It was incredibly noisy because people sit on the porch of the hotel next door talking until 3:00 a.m. The maids do a very mediocre job of cleaning the rooms. Also, they slam doors early in the morning as they are cleaning requiring you to wake up when they start their shfit. The hallways are tiled, and this makes the sound echo very loudly. I could go on but you get the point. If you've read this and still book a trip, god bless you. Yes, the hotel was across from the beach, but after sleeping in filth this was little consolation.

Reviews.Title: “I HATE YOU HAWAII HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Diana G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hawaii Hotel for 4 nights while we were looking for an apartment in Miami. We had booked the trip on Expedia which included flight, hotel and car rental. This hotel ended up costing us $98 per night and I have never felt so ripped off in all my life. Since we had booked the trip on Expedia our room was completely non-refundable. The minute we checked into the hotel and saw our room we were already extremely shocked and requested a cleaner room., the second room wasnâ€™t any better, the floors were grainy from dirt and sand.. the towelâ€™s were dirty, the bed was so soiled my husband and I went to Target to buy our own sheets, towels and pillows. During my entire stay I couldnâ€™t take my shoeâ€™s off at all except to get into bed and the shower was so filled with mold I had to shower with a towel on the floor. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone, no matter how long the stay, unless you have absolutely no cleanliness standers. Personally I feel they should have paid me to stay in it. I HATE YOU HAWAII HOTEL! -Diana Outâ€¦â€¦

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: atoieddu78
Reviews.Content: the hotel and the room were very dirty, and nobody cleaned the room during our 4 days stay at the hotel. to go in there you need to ring the bell and to checkin-in and out you need to go to the hotel next door. very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from Hawaii Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamges
Reviews.Content: Went there last labor day weekend to visit Miami. The check-in is to be done in an adjacent hotel, which looks terrible. The receptionist does not speak english very well and upon check-in, they'd charge you $100 deposit. This wasn't disclosed at all, but since we wanted to have a good time, we let them do that. Coming inside the hotel, you have to buzz in in what sort of looks like a dilapidated building from the outside. Nothing like the images from the website. The rooms are very basic with red walls but the sheets are just plain ugly and there is a pungent smell all over the hotel and especially in the rooms. Walls are pretty thin so you could hear noises either from other rooms or from ghosts, I dunno, not ideal for relaxing. While the beaches are just a few steps away, I would think other hotels are definitely a lot better. I was also charged an additional $50 upon check-out without them informing me and now they wouldn't reverse the charge. Very unprofessional. My advice: stay away from this hotel and find a better deal elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location, bad quality”
Reviews.Author: AmandaB8
Reviews.Content: The price and location were right but that's where the pleasantries end. There seemed to be sand everywhere, there weren't any complimentary toiletries and we never had enough towels. At one point we were even given bath mats for towels! If you don't plan on spending a lot of time in your hotel and want to be close to the beach then this is your place- but if you want a little luxury then stear clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: SEtravelerguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location right on the beach! You literally walk outside and the beach is there. The price is great and includes a basic continental breakfast so that's an added perk. The bed and pillows were so comfortable...I had the best night sleep in a really long time. On the downside, the towels were really dirty and we used our own beach towels instead. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: crapman07
Reviews.Content: Lets face it...if you are going to Miami to chill out, you are not going to stay in the hotel. All you need is a room to sleep in. This is exactly why you should rent this hotel. Whats the point in paying a lot for a lavish hotel when you are going to be outside anyways over the day?? The hotel itself doesn't look awesome from outside, but the rooms are nice, fairly clean and the beds comfortable in the night. Breakfast just contains tea/coffee and microwavable danishes - not so great. It's kinda far from the place to be (South Beach), so you need to arrange for some transportation (we chose bikes). North beach is nice and quaint too if you just wanna lie down. There's wireless in the common breakfast area, and if you are lucky in your room too! I would recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “nice budget place”
Reviews.Author: DareToLive
Reviews.Content: nice spot right by the beach, although about 10-15 min drive (20 min bus ride) to the hip South Beach district.. ok for that price (just ok), breakfast served in a hotel right next door on a nice sunny terrace but consists merely of coffee/tea and packed danishes, rooms small but clean. parking off street, free between 6pm and 8am, if you insert money the night before it will count toward the next morning, eg if you pay for 2 hours at 5pm it will last till 9am, so no need to get up early ;)

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping without blanket???”
Reviews.Author: Pipil0ta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hawaii hotel twice during our stay in Florida. First night was ok, room is nice, shower is ok. The second night we came back after two days and got a room-it was almost the same but there was no blanket in a bed. We asked it and the guy in reception told that they donÂ´t have anymore blankets since some of them are in loundry. Very strange attitude. It seemed him that it is normal to have a room without a blanket-only bed with pillows. Then I asked more bed linen to get at least something to cover. We got an extra bed linen. The guy told us to tell it in the morning to manager. So, in the morning we saw the manager but he didnÂ´t solve the problem either. We asked some discount and he told that we got the room so cheap-no discount. I booked double room via hotels.com for $59.54 I wouldnÂ´t say it is expensive but I donÂ´t think that it is too much to ask to have a blanket. He didnÂ´t say thet he was sorry ...

Reviews.Title: “value for money at the hawaii hotel miami”
Reviews.Author: TravellingY
Reviews.Content: Great location, value for money hotel. This hotel was in a great location, just accross a quiet tree lined streed from the north miami beach. We stayed for 7 nights, room and hotel was clean but basic. Room had 2 double beds, small bathroom with very good power shower, fridge and electronic safe (no charge). Space to hang clothes was very limited. TV in the room was small but perfectly adequate. No view, shutters on the windows, but we didn't find that a problem as we spent little time in the room (only a base and somewhere to sleep). Reception staff were very friendly, rooms cleaned daily and towels changed every day. Breakfast was served a the hotel next door and was not really worth getting up for. Parking is available in the street outside the hotel, you could either pay 6.50 dollars for a parking pass between 12.00 noon - 12.00 noon the next day, but was not always necessary as parking meters were free between 6.00pm and 8.00am. All in all this hotel provided an excellent base in a great location and was certainly value fo rmoney.
